episode: When I was in high school, some friends and I went exploring outside of town.  We ended up crossing a trestle bridge that was clearly only meant for trains.  I've always been pretty afraid of heights so I have no idea how I agreed to this and it was absolutely terrifying.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I think walking on that trestle bridge when I was in high school is probably one of the scariest things I've ever done.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: What made you do it?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Peer pressure I guess?  Haha.  I didn't have to but I was with some friends and we were exploring outside of town and came across it, so we walked across.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Thrill-seeking, huh?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Pretty much.  Not the best idea now that I look back on it.  I really don't like heights.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That must've been terrifying!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: It was.  The "floor" if you could call it that was just a steel grate that you could see right through.  We could see the tops of the trees below us.  It was a very weird feeling.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: My stomach would've been in knots!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Also there was no real guard rails on the sides, just a flimsy chain/cable thing.  One wrong step and any of us could have gone flying over the edge.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's horrific!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Actually I just remembered one of my friends had his dog with him and his dog wouldn't set foot on the bridge.  Like it instinctively knew this was a bad idea.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Smart dog!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yeah definitely.  Much smarter than I was as a teenager haha.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Wisdom of youth, right?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Precisely.  Oh and my buddy stayed with his dog and didn't cross, we didn't just leave him there by himself, in case you were wondering.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Good to know, thanks for clarifying!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Anyway, I still can't believe I did that.  I don't even like going near windows if I'm on the second floor of a building nowadays.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Height phobia stuck with you!

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yeah.  Well I don't know if it's a full on phobia but it's one of the few things that always makes me a bit uncomfortable.  I still don't like flying in planes for example.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Turbulence doesn't help, huh?
